text: Excellent tacos and salsa! Will definitely Come back. Great service too. Very clean and open 24/7 which is great.

At first El presidente looked like a decent place to visit. I WAS WRONG El presidente had some of the spiciest food ever and believe me I've had some spicey food, also kid me not there was a picture of a lady with her ass facing everyone who came in overall I just had a terrible time there.
Went here around 4:30 am on Saturday morning. We did not like the food. Beans looks weird, chicken was undercooked. Service was fine though. Wouldn't come back here.

Ok ....I Love 24 hour places! Not everyone gets off 9pm to 5pm work schedule! Kick Ass Food! Delicious!  Mmmmm......mmmm....Good! Awesome mexican food! Super love the dinner plates . Plus they got desserts! Affordable to all ! : )
This is my one of the favorites for the lunch. Very good traditional soups, best menudo in town. Open 24/7, BYOB.

Not a bad hole in the wall Mexican spot. I like that it's byob and has a cool patio out back! Apparently this is a drunk food central, because it's open 24 hours, but it's not a bad idea to get Mexican food for a casual dinner and bring some beers along. The service was quick and to the point too. The complimentary chips and salsa were great, especially because it came w some pico de gallo. We ordered the shrimp fajitas and chicken mole. Both were pretty hefty dishes and difficult for two people to finish. I can definitely see how drunk people would get their fill of food from this. However, I would say quality and taste were pretty average if you were sober like me.

It's open 24 hours a day every day, they give you freshly fried chips when you eat-in, and it's consistent. It's not the best but those three things make it a solid four stars. I've always had good service for pickup and eat-in and it's been in the neighborhood for decades.
This place is amazing open 24/7 and has great food and service i love them. they deserve 5 stars all day every day
This place is bomb. Always open and always amazing. Go there. It's worth it. Any time is the perfect time for tacos.

Skip this place. Terrible service. We ordered basic food, just tacos and burritos and it took them forever. One burrito must have sat on the counter for 10 minutes before the waitress decided to notice, pick it up and bring it over. Food was not amazing. There are too many other places to eat to ever bother with this place ever again.

If you are in the need of Mexican food past 1 AM, this is your place! To start, they bring you chips and salsa which is delicious. Warning: the salsa is deceivingly hot - probably a 18/25 on the hot scale, equivalent to the " Blazin" hot sauce at Buffalo Wild Wings.  Anyways, for my entree I ordered the steak fajitas. I don't really know, but I'm pretty sure I ate the whole thing. I would recommend getting a side of guac with your meal as well, it's solid.  For late night Mexican food, El Presidente is a great spot!

This place is a lot better than taco burrito house on Fullerton. I do like the food but all the soups are always bland with no flavor. I ordered caldo de res, a small size, and they gave me a large size with no beef. Just vegetables and a giant potato.

Moved to Chicago 3 years ago. Been to many Mexican restaurants looking for the best one. El presidente wins by a landslide ! Friendly service , family owned. Open 365 days 24 hours a day. If you haven't ate here you haven't had good Mexican! Advice from a true San Diegan
We are from Southern California , el presidente is the closest you will get to Mexico ! The best Mexican food in Chicago hands down!! Authentic. I recommend the carnitas plate

Really, this is not a real burrito place. They are overpriced. You have to pay for a burrito dinner. They are a million better and more authentic places. You don't get what you play for!!! They sold out!!!

One of my favorite places in Chicago. It is not the best Mexican food in Chicago, but they are consistent. I know exactly what I'm getting every time I walk in.    BYOB Friendly staff Open 24/7 Love the older women cooking in the back.

This is an authentic Mexican food restaurant. It's not amazing but not awful either. The food is not expensive and the portions are generous. I always get the menudo and a chicken quesadilla.  Generally Mexican food is not super salty. If you are looking for Americanized food.. then this is probably not the place for you.

Went there for the first time yesterday with my friend.  She is Mexican and said it is authentic and one of her favorite Mexican places,  we started with chips and salsa and horchata, both were very good, the horchata could have been a little sweeter but I still enjoyed it. The chips and salsa were great. Chips tasted homemade and the salsas were great, very flavorful and spicy! They gave us a pico de Gallo and another one that looked like thin tomato sauce great spicy, smoky tomato flavors.  For my entree I got a breaded chicken torta ,  delicious! Very different from any other torta I've ordered but much better as well.!Bread was fantastic and the chicken paired very well with all the toppings included on the sandwich.  My friend ordered a small chicken soup and it was filled with large portions of chicken and whole vegetables, a soup that looked like a meal! Very good food, staff friendly but not always available if you need something, but great place overall!
I have eaten here multiple times and it is the absolute worst Mexican food i have ever had.... The food did not have any flavor EVEN when intoxicated. Did not enjoy this restaurant at all.

First time eating at this place and I would go back for sure. It is open 27/7 365 days a year. I don't live close to it or else I would be a frequent diner. It was pretty empty when we went but the service was great and they were all real nice there. I knew it was going to be amazing when I saw Mexican women cooking in the back. I was right, it tasted like I was eating my mother in laws cooking : ) I had three chicken tacos w rice and beans. They make their own tortillas too, which makes it all the better!! We also go two queso fundido, one with out the chorizo. That too was amazing along with the guacamole too.

According to Facebook, I had visited this place 3 times in 2011.  Living out to the burbs, I only make it out to the city once in a while...this is a good late night place.  A friend of mine used  to live in the area and brought me here... we went after shows at Cubby Bear in Wrigleyville. I visited again last night. This place is open 24/7. As with all Mexican establishments, you get chips & salsa upon sitting down...one wasn't bad, one was HOT!!! But, not horrible.  We ordered a side of guacamole which wasn't the greatest, it was rather bland.  Aside from that, we all enjoyed our meals.  I always order the chicken flautas...they're very good along with the side of rice & beans. Service has always been quick & friendly here.  It's worth checking out!

I come on a regular basis in the mornings for breakfast. They have a great special for $5.50 which includes 2 eggs, meat, toast, hash browns and coffee until a certain time. Service has always been wonderful and the servers are always kind and attentive. Sometimes there's a language gap but it has never affected my order. I was the only table on the patio once on a nice summer day and the service was still attentive. The Mexican food I order is tasty for a decent price. To sum it all up, it's a clean hole in the wall Mexican restaurant with good Mexican food.  There's always a good crowd in the mid mornings during the weekdays and weekends when I go. That says a lot for itself.

Awful.  Long wait, terrible food.  Burrito had nothing in it except under seasoned steak.  Found an avocado stem in my girlfriends ground beef tacos... Just the worst.  Guacamole also had zero seasoning.  Do not go here for any reason.
I was craving Mexican late at night, and this place filled the bill to a T! Nice ladies, fast service, and the burrito comes with sour cream, guacamole, and rice!
Good food at a fair price. nothing fancy, but filling.

5 stars rating as a non upscale Mexican restaurant.  If you aren't a prude or an elitist socialite (or a wannabe) or if you are looking for good cheap fast Mexican food this is your place.  And for you late night after bar folks, this is a 24/7 restaurant.  Keep in mind that some of these critics reviews read as if they were expecting to dine at Chez Paul.  Great spot, one of my two fav Mexican joints in Chicago (La Pasadita).

Alrighty...I've been coming to this restaurant a couple of times and this last visit was apparent that it will be my last.I've given this restaurant another try by making a appearence and i just now I feel that there isn't anything special about this place,except for the beautiful artwork.. So. My mother and I decide to go to this restaurant because her favorite is Chicken  mole.so  Upon arriving,there was one waitress and one bus boy(its was grown guy).My mother went to the restroom as i sat at a table(my first selection was dirty so i had to choose again).The busboy apparently had put chips and condiments on the table and apparently cough without turning his head..(which was disgusting..luckily i turned my head just in time)The salsa's bowl looked stained in one area with either previous residue or from that bus boy's fingers.. I think the biggest disappointed was which in some of these review quoted the food as cheap...hell no. it seem that they increased they're prices ridiculously..how does a $9.00 dollars dish go up to $11.00 dollars.  Well my mother and I decide to eat regardless (HINT:since it was our last time)So my mother ordered Horchata (which tasted terribly sweet,it was as if they added more sugar then needed..hell of alot of sugar) and I ordered unsweetened iced tea...(which they put a piece lime on it and it looked rather old)we put in our order,I got Chicken and Rice ($10.50)(Which I usually got the chicken,shrimp and crabmeat dish but unfortunately it went up to $14.50 Dollars) and my Mother got the Chicken mole ($11.00).Upon receiving the food,i didnt really look at in full close  detail.so  i was eating and i spotted what seemed like a piece of black hair or piece of synthetic black hair like from a wig or something..(I have bright pinkyish red hair).So I lost my appetite..after the first couple things,i decided well this is the last time,im coming here..so i didn't say anything and not once did the waitress come over to our table to ask if we needed anything or nothing of that sort . The restaurant was not full and it was only our table and another table.(that was it!) So we were going to decide to have the Chicken Mole to go but the waitress apparently had recieved a call for a order.(my mother asked if i was sure about taking the food to go and said yes )then i told my mother to forget it( (because the bus boy was useless and after that incident i said forget it!)So we got up to pay for our food and the waitress was still on the phone taking a order. At first we were nice and patient....time pass...the waitress is still writing a order..time  pass.my  mother signal the bus boy (which was pointless because he just walk by us and walk around the waitress ...that was it lmao) Time passes...i told my mother that I'll wait to pay for it and told her to go to her car (since my mother had knee surgery) ..time passes...I stare at the useless bus boy (who isnt picking up our dirty dishes or cleaning tables just standing there) I stare at the people who i can see from the kitchen...time passes..new customers come in..I continue to staring..then a cook from the kitchen comes by me and asks if i want to pay then takes my credit card but doesn't really help me because she put my card near the waitress still on the phone ..I stare at the ceiling (like wtf was that for)so the waitress finishes...instead of taking care of me,she takes the five page order (she wrote big) to the kitchen...time passes..she finishes our order card...and thanks me for waiting..which i smiled (BECAUSE I KNEW THIS WAS THE LAST TIME I WAS STEPPING IN THAT JOINT) Bottom line= I gave it  two stars due to the lack of customer service,ridiculously over priced food prices and only thing memorable was the pretty paintings on the wall...case CLOSED!

I'm glad I didn't let the other terrible reviews steer me away from this place. Where else in Chicago can you get a great, authentic Mexican dinner at 5:00am? Yes, there's Taco Burrito King which I've settled for in the past, but this is Authentic Mexican food done right. Super cheap and they have Mexican sweet bread! I felt like I was back at my Mexican childhood friend's house, where I used to drag out my stay, knowing dinner would be served soon. I really enjoyed this place, very tasty!

We decided to try this place because we read rick bayless' rave review of their chilaquiles but it was overall not so good. The chilaquiles were okay but everything else was super disappointing. The tacos were not very edible and the torta was just as bad.

Delicious authentic Mexican Chilaquiles (special order 1/2 red sauce, 1/2 green sauce, because I wanted to try both). The green sauce won hands down! And, although it's not on the menu, splurged on a glass of chocolate milk that was thick and delicious like a milk shake. Friendly waitstaff and great service. I'll definitely be back.

Best Mexican food in the city, and cheap!  Warning--this is real Mex, not Tex-Mex like Uncle Julio's. In the summer, they have outdoor tables out back.  I also like to order my New Year's tamales from them.

Pretty gross food, but we didn't get sick, so that's a plus. The waitress was super nice, but we won't be back. Probably tolerable for late-night grub when you are super shit-faced as it is adequate food to soak up booze and the ambiance is not unpleasant.
The food here is good quality and at a good price. The service is friendly and quick. It is definitely a late night spot but I enjoy going there any time of the day.

First, I only went because of the big sign on the window. They Lied! 2 bacon 2 sausage, and 2 eggs for $5.50. When you get in they say it's only 1 single meat! I had to order double. Then I get my food, and it was not even a piece of bacon, sliced in half!! Arrrh! Then I sat and flipped out the broken seat. I'm done. Wow!

Been coming here for years. Always good food and friendly service. The steak burrito suiza is delicious and their mole sauce is delicious. Which comes on that burrito. I also love their tacos el pastor.  The prices are relatively fair 7.50 for 3 tacos with rice and beans

The food is relatively cheap. Pretty good tasting overall, nothing special. The service was ridiculously slow. There were maybe 4 tables for 5 servers, and it still took our waitress a great deal of time to take our order, bring us our food (had to ask for items multiple times because it was obvious that she forgot), and even longer to get around to our check.  I'd probably only come again if I was in the neighborhood and nothing else was really available (which is actually pretty common for this area).

Definitely recommend. A couple buddies and I just happened to stop in for dinner. It was pretty dead which was surprising at that hour on a weekend. The service was excellent. Our waitress would notice us running low on salsa and would be there with a refill before we even asked. (Happened a few times). The food was very good. And the price was even better. Definitely recommend.

My mom loves this place for their chicken mole but honestly  lets be frank, the food Is delicious but the prices just seem over priced.the service can be good at time and it can be uncool, especially when it's not even busy.its waitresses can be very rude but they do get the orders correctly.i would probably go there from time to time .:-3

Grew up coming here and my parents insist on coming here because the owner is from my family's town in Mexico.  Yeah, yeah, the food isn't the best in the world, but it's affordable. You can go to Frontera or any other place that charges an arm and a leg, but are you going to really get that authentic meal that a little old lady in an apron stirring the pot all day made?  The place is open every single day of the year and 24 hours a day. When your hungover butt needs some greasy food where are you going to go? Your tummy isn't going to feel that great if you choose Taco Hell instead.  My absolute favorite item on their menu is the Pozole. A big ass bowl comes with all the fixings and they don't skimp on the hominy. I shouldn't be telling the yelp world about the pozole. I fear that when I show up there won't be any for me!  Another one of my favorites is their horchata (cinnamon rice drink). I dubbed it the best in the city of Chicago, but beware, sometimes they have their bad days and it tastes like popcorn Jelly Bellies.  Again, the food isn't the best in the world, but it is in my top 5 Mexican restaurants in Chicago. Enjoy!
Great food at a reasonable price! I love the fact that its a BYOB place! You cannot go wrong here for authentic Mexican food.

It nevr closes... really great as a 4th meal and even during the day. I'm a big fan of their steak burritos, nachos and combination plates. They are generous with their portions and have great guac! I live so close that its always a great go to mexican retaurant.
Great place to have tacos and good food. great service. it family own so u feel like u are at home wit family.

This is my first choice every single time anyone suggests going to lunch... or really doing any activities. I am obsessed. The bathrooms aren't the cleanest, true, but the atmosphere is great. There is always a booth, there is always parking, the air conditioning is good, the waitresses are always there to help, they are accommodating... it goes on and on. I'll be moving nearby soon and I'm not going to lie and say the proximity to el pres had NOTHING to do with it... ;) Always get the enchiladas suizas with chicken OR the nachos. And always get ranchero sauce on the side. You will not regret it.

I been frequenting this restaurant since its inception. Although I have moved away from the area and no longer frequent it as much, I stop by whenever I'm in the neighborhood. Everything in the menu is good quality and delicious. The tacos have generous portions. The tortas are a family favorite. Try the nachos with their special ranchero sauce (not spicy at all just flavorful). If you want something new, try the Camarones al Estilo Zacatecas (Zacatecas style Shrimp). They have a unique and exquisite flavor. The servers are attentive and accomodating. Friends that I take there continue to frequent afterward.

This place is open 365/24/7.  It is BYOB. They have a lovey outdoor patio.  They are super nice and try to have good service.  It is not very expensive.The place seems very clean.Been here forever. We stopped in here for a very late (4pm) lunch before we went to the movies.  In any ohter town, this would be your go-to mexi-american place, but in the Chi, we are used to much, much better food--not much good--chips were greasy, beans were old fashioned pureed style--cheese was glurpy.  Maybe ok to sit outside with byo and have some nachos, but I won't be back--Places like this are on every corner--skip this one.  Message me about your fav taco place

This place sucks. My mom and her ex used to go here and took me and my bf with one time. I found a fly in my food. Gross, bad service bad food. people were mean. and we  all kinda just felt awkward there. it wasnt fun there was no music and sweaty people in the back cooking flys. NNNNNOOOOO!

When you look at the menu and see all the choices, you feel that you will be overwhelmed with some delicious Mexican food. Unfortunately, that is not the case for this place. The price for the food is pretty cheap and it makes sense. I wasn't impressed with the salsas that they provide at the start of your meal----the food was just okay, it was kind of bland and just lacked the unique Mexican flavor. The only bonus for this place is that is open for late----but you will certainly run into drunk patrons like any other restaurant that is open that late. So many different places that are better in the city.

I'm scared of this place. It seems dirty. The food was alright but I was really drunk so pretty much anything can taste good. I only give it two stars because there are other places in the area that are so much better. If you're starving at 4Am and have absolutely no other options is the only reason you should go here.

Wow! We decided to try this out for sunday breakfast for two reasons: 1. it was walking distance to our house. 2. they were advertising an "american breakfast" with a big sign on the street. We arrived too late for the breakfast, so instead we ordered the Huevos al la Mexicana. OMG! The dish was excellent. They did scrambled eggs tomato, onion, and jalepeno mixed together. It was very tastey with just enough spiciness. The plate had refried beans and rice. I had flour tortilla and my husband had corn. We loved it! We can wait to come back in the summer with friends and bring some beers and chill on their patio eating delicious mexican food!!
Great home cooking, great price, friendly people and LOVE the chicken soup on a cold day or feeing a little under the weather

So we went to El Presidente last night.... and it freaking SUCKED!!!! man we were driving down ashland from the far north side on the way to the burly to see some tight mind-bending neon marshmallow-type figgity fucked up musak.   and we were like 'hey bro! we should jam on some tacosies'.  and i remember a while back when i was way into huarache's i had heard about a place off ashland that had them. i thought it was el presidente.  let me tell you something folks - el presidente doesnt have any huaraches - that's the damn truth.   let me tell you what they do have though: 1. spoons in coffee - hate that.  if i wanted to drink metal coffee i would.... heck i dont know what i would do if i wanted to drink metal coffee - it's never freaking happened to me before because metal coffee is gross.  2. no music. they have one of those 'pay for some tunes' things. i hate those things. it's like have we already gotten to the point as a society where literally everything that human beings come in contact with they have to pay for? sad world.  3. the food. we all agreed that the food wasn't that good. it was really bad. i had this burrito - the steak was really bad. cheap steak. my girlfriend had some gross veggie tacos. my friend had some huevos mexicanos, but he was so turned off about his metal coffee that he really didnt have much of an appetite.  let me put it this way - no mas el presidente. no mas.

I should start off by saying that I've browsed yelp for months and never thought I'd be interested in being a member or even writing reviews but alas, on a slow day at work, I decided to sign up and offer some insight. To say this is one of my favorite restauraunts is an understatement. My mother has been coming here for the last 20 years or so (crazy to think it's been around that long). Naturally, she brought me here at a young age and I've been in love ever since. Whenever we have a taco craving, this has been our place.  This place gets a bad rep and I don't  blame you. You get what you pay for and sometimes this place can be a real hit or miss. I've come here and enjoyed some of the best food I have ever tasted and other times, it didn't sit very well with me. I know we would all like to have a perfect dining experience every time but things happen and it certainly doesn't change my opinion. I see a few reviews that bash the personalities of the employees. Maybe it's just because I've been coming here for so long but these are some of the sweetest women I have ever met. Maybe they come off as shy but they get their job done. If you've been here, you know your food comes fast but sometimes they do get busy. Relax, take a breather, and enjoy your time there. Also, try to strike up a conversation and you'll soon realize that they actually do have a personality. I've seen and heard a lot of customers here act like complete pricks to these women for no reason at all. I'd be pretty quiet, too if I had to tolerate that every day. With that being said, maybe this place isn't your cup of tea and that's fine. Maybe you prefer a fancy dining experience and exquisite food on your plate. It's a taco joint, the food is flavorful, and their hot sauce is impeccable.  And for those of you complaining they don't serve alcohol, it's BYOB.
The food is...pretty good.  They make you pay a juke-box instead of just having music play, which I thought was annoying.  No booze, so No Margaritas, the guacamole sucked, the horchata was good.

This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in Chicago. The food is great and the prices cannot be beat. Definitely a dive joint, but that's probably what makes it so good. The free chips and salsa are both homemade and excellent. Also, if you want to drink, the place is BYOB. They are open 24/7, including holidays. The only area this place is lacking is service: Sometimes it's a little slow to get table service. Once you place your order, however, the food comes fast. All things considered, 5 stars.

Another one of my favorite late night Mei can restaurants.  Open 365 days a year, 7 days a week and 24 hours a day.  Who could beat that!? I stumbled in here a multitude of times after rough nights in the city.  It quickly became my late night go to place for some yummy homemade munchies.  El Presidente never disappointed. You also never have to worry about being the only people dining there.  Somehow they manage to have a steady flow of diners at all hours. I love that they quickly bring you chips and salsa along with water as soon as you sit down. They always have daily specials to try out.  I have never been disappointed by anything I have ordered here.  El Presidente will always have a special place in my heart.

My family and I have been going here for 16 years and after my visit last Friday I AIN'T GOING BACK...the service was slow/lousy (only 10 other customers), the order was wrong (they gave me a nasty look) really?  the food was dry, and I sat there confused.  Again after 16 years of a family of 5 sometimes 9 when family members are in town experiencing delicious food, SOMETHING JUST AIN'T RIGHT.  Money is tight and I will try out a new place vs spending my money here.

this place has some pretty bad reviews but i happen to love it. its a cheap meal that is actually really really good. everything tastes really fresh and while it may not be the fine dining service(who was expecting that for a $6 monster plate of food - thats the price of a Mc. Donalds value meal...) you get friendly staff and food that tastes like home cooked. been a regular for a while, will continue to be.

Went to eat dinner here on a whim and was disappointed.  Somebody told me this place had excellent Mexican food.  Now I know never to listen to that person's opinion on food anymore.  :)  I definitely have had much better steak tacos and rice elsewhere.   Also, this place does not have alcohol.  After a long day at work, my friend needed a Corona and was told there wasn't any alcohol.  What Mexican restaurant does not carry Corona??  I don't think this place should be open 24 hours-there's really no point in it.

Let me start with this... I was a regular customer for years, 3-4 times a week, specially weekends after bars. 3 months ago visited the restaurant after night club we ordered, chilaquiles and enchiladas. When I got home I got sick, I had diarrhea and I was vomiting... Next day I called the owner to inform about this situation and she was not available, person in charge told me she was shopping in south side, I left a message asking to return my call. 3 house later I receive a call from the restaurant asking me what was the reason of my call, I asked the person on the phone if she was the owner, and her answer was, No I am not the owner she is busy and she can't return her call... Guys?? Please give me a break, That means " customers are not important for this person?" What kind of person is running this business. I called to the restaurant just to inform of the situation and other people don't get sick, I never asked for my money back or free food because as a regular customer I understood the situation, but come on guys... still I don't understand this person was spending my money shopping while we were sick.. and Every time when we went to the bathroom we were thinking about El Presidente and "doña Lupe". Just to be honest we gave another chance and we found this time kitchen dirty, slow service (because one more time, she wants save money and not hire extra persons to improve their service) and same person running this business. I called Health Department to let them know about this situation... Service is great, food ok, restaurant dirty and if we talk about person running business Doña Lupe is a very irresponsible person about her business.
Not quite as awful as I thought it might be (that's a compliment) but definitely not good.

This place can SMD.  I have been to countless Mexican restaurants all through out Chicago and this has to rank as one of the worst ones in my opinion. My coworker used to rave about how great this place is. I came here once and the experience was definitely forgettable. I gave it another shot a couple weeks ago since I was in the neighborhood and had a craving for some Mexican food.  We ordered the guacamole, pozole, and carnitas.  Guac - Weak like baby. Could not taste the onions or lime juice.  Pozole - Weak like little puppy. Weakest pozole in the city. Bland.  Carnitas - Weak like grass. Even weaker than the pozole. The worst of the meal. Just dry, unseasoned pork that was over cooked. Lacing the pork with layers of salsa could not even save this travesty.  Maybe I'm being too harsh, but I have been to way too many Mexican restaurants to feel any type of sympathy for the sorry food they put out.

The fact that they are always open is part of El Presidente's charm. The bright fluorescent lights, which highlight the clock (which I suspect, at this point, reads 2:45 am) are charming as well, as are the high ceilings and paintings of horses and such. Even the smell of the bathroom deodorants add to the overall 'all-night you're welcome here regardless of your state' atmosphere. The waitresses, without fail, smile; god knows why. The food is good and hearty. The pico keeps coming if that is what you, my inebriated friend, would like. And you can take your leftovers home. If you can find it. (Your home, that is.) God love the staff here. Such patience. Overall, a good experience, always. Filling and tasty.
24hrs.....never been there before 3........cheap and they let you walk around wasted.....love it
I've been going here for about 10 years now.  Love the tortas!  Can't beat them anywhere else.  Love this place!
The burrito was tasty and they give you plenty of meat. guacamole was flavorful and seemed fresh. Service was friendly and quick. Will def go back!

I've been here once and once only, because it's not the sort of place you seek out on purpose. No, what El Presidente specializes in is drunken patrons staggering into the lonely corner establishment because there's nothing else viable in sight. And on this night, I was such a patron. Even in my mildly inebriated state of being, I knew to lower my expectations. Yet even with the lowest of standards, the food here was barely passable. Perhaps in a smaller town or even in a different part of the city, this would have been acceptable, but not here. The food was incredibly bland and undercooked, and the server (understandably at this hour) could not care less about us. If you're in dire need of decent Mexican food in the wee hours of the morn, make the extra trek to Allende on Lincoln and Fullerton or even the Golden Apple Diner further up north on Lincoln, to keep your dignity and pallet intact.

If zero stars were an option - this place would get it.  I have worked in the restaurant business so I know how difficult of a job it is, so it takes quite a bit to lead me to the point of leaving this review.  This is BY FAR the worst experience I have ever had in my entire dining life. We ordered 3 burritos and chips and salsa for delivery. The delivery man came, who was nice (outside service) and we only received two of the three burritos and no chips and salsa. We called to tell the place, we were put on hold for probably 8 minutes. To make this short, we never received the third burrito or chips and salsa. The women on the phone was not apologetic at all, made it seem that it was our fault.  To top it off, the two burritos we did receive, were cold (and terrible tasting). My roommate found a piece of a plastic (we believe it to be part of a plastic fork) inher burrito. When we called to tell the manager working, she played it off, and mocked us saying "well if you need to go to the ER then go."  DO NOT give this place your business.  It may be cheap, but so is their food and service.  ps. if you want diarrhea within an hour after eating (and I only ate 10 bites), then this is your place.

i echo other reviews -- love their refried beans and pico de gallo.  i often get burritos sans meat and el presidente has one of the best i have tried.  i have dined in and it was fine -- pretty good service.  i have also ordered through grub hub and there were no problems with my order and it arrived pretty fast.

2 stars for being open late and I was hungry.  I ordered 3 veggies tacos with extra guacamole, and ended up getting at least 2 of 3 tacos that only had rice in them!  Nothing else.  WTF??  I will cut them some slack because it was 3 am on Halloween weekend, but just because I'm tipsy doesn't mean I won't notice that you forgot to put anything tasty in my taco. My hubby had a beef torta that was average at best. Tasted like they used really  low quality ingredients.
The corn flour tortillas are handmade and the best soup around.   Love it when the best cook is inthe house!   Love Quacamole!

I love El Presidente! This place has the best pico de gallo, and even though a lot of the time there is a bit of a language barrier, they always get my order right. The waitresses in here have to put up with a lot of crap from drunken late night customers, so tip them well!

Been coming here for years I love it. This is the only mexican resaurant I go to.food is always awesome . The pico de gallo and salsa is very tasty. They have the best rice and refried bean.service is good although sometimes you have beg to get the check. Will be eating here till one of us closes or dies.

Had my first meal of 2011 here...it was the worst meal ever.  Ordered a chicken burrito, a standard Mexican dish, how can you go wrong, right?  Wrong! One bite and I had to stop eating.  First, my chicken was PINK! I wasn't the only one at the table with pink chicken either.  Second, I was disappointed at the lack of cheese.  Luckily, for me I filled up on enough chips and salsa.  That's the only thing going for this place.  I didn't think it was possible to mess up Mexican, but they did...even with a drunk palate.

Not a bad place, The indoors were kept pretty clean. The food wasn't bad either. The place is a 24 hours hangout as well. Although, the restrooms could be better. Yet another thing, They could ALSO use cheddar cheese along with the Supremo cheese they have.

Open 24 Hours, great for late night drunken hunger. Which admittedly is the only times I have stopped in here, but as far as I can remember, I constantly love the food here! Something about a constant flow of chips and pico de gallo makes me a happy camper. And it's a block away from where I live, so can't argue with convenience!

"More pico de gallo?" she asked. I swoon! In a city over run with Mexican eateries - there are few that stand cabeza y los hombros above the rest. El Presidente on Ashland is easily one of them.  The service is quick and no nonsense. Everything comes with a smile - gratis. Beginning with perfectly fried nacho chips and a saucer of hot sauce and a saucer of fresh and delicious pico. I feel bad that I didn't suggest to my dinner-mate to stop from time to time to count his fingers.  Good pico de gallo is awesome - fresh pico de gallo is crack to a fat guy.    My friend got a steak and eggs - I went with the quesadilla dinner.  His steak - and all of the trimmings - was picture perfect. The gleaming white eggs cooked just right laid perfectly on top of the brown steak - highlighted with a saucy red - uh - sauce.  I might have been envious if my food were not perfect. Cheese cooked to softness - but not runniness. (Is runniness a word?) Rice and beans without a flaw. Little salad on the side. More chips and pico to blend with the frijoles.  The whole thing - two full dinners (remember one was steak and eggs) and the bill is under 20 bucks (before big tip for incredible service.) Been there a number of times - will always go back. Great service - great food and excess pico de gallo. Boo-Yah!

I used to work night/bar shifts. At least once a week, my friend Jeanette and I would help close up the bar then head over around 3am and have our late late dinner/early breakfast at El Presidente. Huevos con chorizo and a pina Jarritos before we went grocery shopping. DAMN! I love the combo of 24/7 Mexican restaurant AND 24/7 grocery stores. If i was a better person, I would belog to the 24/7 health club just down the block, but sadly....

Tacos at 2 am after a long night of music.  Nothing gets better...aside from the table next to us butting into our conversation to correct the lyrics to a song, "pardon me but its 'ease on down the road'".

fantastic.  wonderful.  go here!  we come to el presidente after shows with a small group of people,  and everything we order is HUGE and delicious.  I like the chicken enchiladas the best,  although last night I had flautas which were just as good.  Seriously,  everything people order they love.  Highly recommended. AND ITS 24 HOURS!!

This place has a decent variety of authentic Mexican food. The soups are pretty tasty. They give you a ton of food when you order the Presidente Especial. I couldn't finish the tamale, which was eh. The liquados are awesome! Banana ftw! I go here on Saturdays usually during the day. Oh and btw I heard at random times the owner appears, I haven't seen him but apparently my friend who's aunt owns it has. Enjoy!

Open 24 hours? This is an automatic extra star. The food has been quite good, but I'm not overly impressed. The prices are so/so...a little bit on the expensive side, but having rice and beans included is clutch. I'm very lucky to have this gem on my corner!

This is great food! Myself, my family, and tons of family friends have been going to El Presidente for over 25 years. When we think of Mexican food in Chicago, this is where we go. The pico de gallo and hot sauce with homemade tortilla chips hits the spot every time. The nachos are delicious made with the most amazing refried beans....you know what the secret ingredient is?? Lard! If youre trying to be healthy their guacamole is arguably the best you can buy in Chicago. Their pork burrito suizo is filled with the best pork in town according to my pork connesouier father.  I would like to put it on the record that I have never once gotten sick and I have never heard a horror story from any of the 20+ people I know that swear by this restaurant. It's byob and every time I go I find someone i know eating there and we join them and it turns into a party. Great group outdoor seating in the summer.  My only complaint....bring back pepsi in a bottle!!!!

Been going here since I was a child before it was expanded.  I went in there a couple of months ago and my side of the booth was broken like a see-saw.  Time for another remodel.  I think its the lard that makes the food taste so good, that and pepper?

I was in the neighborhood and really wanted some breakfast food.   I got there at 11:05 -- past the breakfast menu.  But the waitress let me order breakfast anyway, so I got the American (3.99).  It was very good; the bacon was very crispy but I liked it that way.  The chips and sauce before that was fresh and good, too.   Plus the staff was very nice and accomodating.  I'll definitely go back - especially for lunch.
Had the Breakfast $3.99 was ok then 1/2 hour after eating there I got sick.

I went there on a Monday night around 12AM. There were only two other tables with people at them, but the place didn't feel empty. Food is pretty good, nothing special, but I do recommend the steak burrito suizo. Good place for late night eats. No alcohol.

I have lived down the street from El Presidente and would like to give my honest non-inebriated point of review. I eat at the restaurant about 5 times a year, family members eat there every week. Their meet is pre-made in huge bowls in their dirty kitchen, that's why it's always dried out. Their pico de gallo is usually days old when it hits the table-notice the deteriorating tomatoes. The place is dirty, the kitchen dirtier than the rat infested attached garage where their kids play. The wait staff does not care-because they are being taken advantage of and are waiting for an opportunnity to escape this hole. The food in general sucks. The meet is old and dried up, and the plates slapped together. Anyone who is looking for something other than late nite swill after a drunken nite out is better off going somewhere else. Did I mention I got food poisoning here? I mean I was violently ill for like 4 days from a carne asada taco. Try the taco/burrito house @1548 w. Fullerton for real Mexican food.

This place must've gone downhill in the past few years, because I went here for fifteen years ending ten years ago. That being said, the chilaquiles are the shiz! With the hot chocolate. Just get the chilaquiles.
This place is just dirty. Flies in soups and roaches on the floor. We left and my friend called the health department. Don't waste your time or money here!

open 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.   i always order the taco salad with carne asada.  it's delicious and better than any other Mexican restaurant in the neighborhood. the wait staff has always been extremely polite.  and it's hard dealing with drunk yuppies or college students in the middle of the night who don't speak your language.

Open 24/7, a block away from my apartment, and affordable. I haven't had anything I could complain about. I only ever get take-out, so I can't comment on dine-in service. Service for carry out has never been an incredibly long wait, the waitress is nice, even when I have no clue what she's talking about, and my orders are correct.  For the price it's decent and what I would expect. I REALLY REALLY love their chips, and the salsa and guacamole have consistently been good. However, every time I go everything is different. Like each person that cooks has a different idea of how the meals should be prepared. Fine with me since it's never been disappointing and I like variety.  Guy ordered a chicken burrito, and that is what he got. TONS of shredded chicken in a tortilla shell. Not for some people, but was really well seasoned and moist.  This isn't a Michelin Star eatery, but I don't think they pretend to be. The menu is cheap, and you get what you pay for, and that's just fine with me.

Not a bad 24 hr BYO taqueria by any stretch.  I would actually deem it "classy" in comparison.  Solid food- exactly what I look for in a burrito and a staff that's good with a slightly liquored up group.  I especially enjoyed the paintings: they had a 'magic eye' quality to them somehow but I guess it depends greatly on having a certain point of view, like many of the truths we cling to.

I lived about a block away from this place and have seen it packed late at night.  Good thing, right?  That means it must be great?  Not so much, since the service is INCREDIBLY slow.  I remember waiting for over an hour once for our food.  Unreal.  Skip this place, especially when it's late night, and visit Taco & Burrito House just down the street.
Not even drunkenness can overcome this poison pit. Avoid at all costs
The place is kind of dirty and the food .. well let's just say now when I go there I just order a coke to go!

Well I have lived about 2 houses down from this place for about a year now. The food is okay, the steak tacos are great and so are the tortillas.  The place is a little dirty, but the patio is BYOB. It is family owned and there seems to be a lot of random children roaming around the kitchen and patio area quite often. One reason why I only gave it 3 stars was because you cant use a debit card on purchases under $10 which I found out the hard way one intoxicated night. And also, not one person speaks a bit of English, so sometimes I just don't know what they are saying.  I usually figure it out and I am a regular usually on the weekends coming home from the bar, but still, sometimes its a tid bit annoying :)

I have been looking for a Mexican joint around here that can stand up to the joint I usually frequented when I lived up in Edgewater. I was hoping this place would fit the bill, being open 24/7 and serving breakfast.  We had steak tacos and carnitas.  The steak tacos were actually pretty big and flavors were good but not great. The carnitas were pretty good too but I was also hoping they would be more flavorful. The pico de gallo was way too spicy. They didn't give us any salsa verde (maybe I was supposed to ask? usually these places give you red and green sauce). The tres leches cake had an artificial taste to it, possibly a combination of imitation vanilla and whipped topping made out of partially hydrogenated fats. And the total turned out to be twice as much as we would have spent had we bought the same amount of food elsewhere.  Overall it was OK but rather than coming back here I'm resuming my search for the tastiest local Mexican grease joint.

Man. I don't know. I don't trust myself when I'm drunk, I guess.  The problem is, even when I am drunk and here, I can't help by think "Dear Jesus Techno Allah, what the hell have I done?" I once made the mistake of ordering to go when it was real late and I didn't realize there are better Mexican places blocks away both north and south (note: I live right by here).. I was unpleasantly surprised to find that not only did everything I order really suck, but there was a hair on it. I mean, shit happens, but the food wasn't even good! I would have salvaged if it was, but nah. Anyway, they get 2 stars for serving me much needed water and chips when I'm drunk. Thanks, dudes.

I cannot say enough for this place. My favorite mexican place ever. I love its hours and being able to call up for food on the go.  I dream about their bean burrito. I guess I can't say much for most the rest of their menu since the burrito is my obsession, but their tortilla chips are beyond amazing; freshly cooked and so crispy. I go here sober or drunk and love it no matter what. Its not gourmet mexican, but for something simple and delicious this is my choice.

I could write a million average reviews about mexican restaurants in Chicago.  This dining experience was funny to me so I thought I would share.  The decor is perfectly described by another yelper as Denny's dinner..That's pretty much it.  The "salsa" is like hot ketchup.  The chips were homemade and wonderful.  The pico de galla is also homemade and yummy.  The dinner was ok.  Presentation was nice.  Waitstaff struck me as funny as they had a "do as little as possible to get by" attitude.  When I went into the place I was the only customer.  Everytime someone would walk in to pick up there take out they would crank up there Mexican music on there terrible speaker system.  As soon as they would leave they would turn it off again.  This happened 3 times in the course of my meal.  I guess I wasn't worth laaving the music on for.  I had to ask for more pico de gallo 4 times, putting the empty bowl to the far edge of the table wasn't hint enough...and the waitress never brought me my bill.  I simply left the money on the table just guessing what tip and tax would be on top of meal.  The staff could have been way more attentive.  I went in at 5:30pm on a Thursday so it's not like it was 3 in the morning...It was a really odd experience.
Mexican version of Dennys. 'nuff said. Expect food is better if you are out drinking and its 4am?
i love their delicious tacos. their service is very fast and friendly. they know my buddies and me, and always seem to give us a hook up each time we stop by.

I've wanted to go to El Presidente for a long time.  It looks like some awesome Mexican dive that would be right up my alley.  When I finally went last night I was very disappointed.  It's a dive, but without any charm and bad food.  I should have read the reviews on here first and tried it when I was drunk because going sober sucked.  It is byob which was one of the only things I liked about it.  I would skip this place unless you are coming back from the bar late night and even then I'm sure you can find someplace better.

el presidente.  wow.  my friends and i have been going here for about 8 years now.  never before 2 a.m. and never anywhere close to sober.  the 24 hour, BYOB model is phenomenal -- i had very high expectations the first time i went there.   so 1 star for being 24 hour, BYOB.  this place doesn't get another star from me though until they change their model to also be BYOFood.  on a very long menu, there is literally not one thing that is close to edible (it rivals cy's crab house, whose french fries look like the skin of an old, dying man).  it's late night food guys -- fry something, melt cheese on it, and cover it in guacamole.  at this point, why not just serve hot pockets? do people actually go here during normal business hours?  what is wrong with you?  there's a wendy's 2 blocks away.  all of that said, i'm sure i'll end up here at least monthly for the next 8 years...
Cheap mexican eats. Order off the appetizer menu. The burritos are huge and tasty. We had the chicken burrito and the steak. Nice salsa with chips. Bit salty. Cheap and easy street parking.

Went there about 11AM and was only one of two tables in the restaurant, and yet it took them several minutes to come over and take our order. The tiny portion of pico de gallo was amusing with a basket of chips. The carne asada tacos were good, but at $8.50, not a steal. The tostadas were OK too. Not great. Just OK. I am sure the 4 and 5 star reviews are more from the 24 hour slew of people who are coming in from a hard night of partying. All food tastes good then.
Very good food.  We went on Thanksgiving.  Not very busy naturally.  My guy had carne asada and it was tender as well as delicious.  I had the cheese quesadilla.  We will come again.

i've heard of menudo a lot, kind of been wanting to try it.  The menu said tripe soup, and it was definitely TRIPE soup.  ONLY TRIPE...nothing else.  I usually like tripe but the broth was sooo overwhelmingly tripey.  The soup also comes with some lime, tortillas and onions.  If you make a tripe taco and squeeze in a lot of lime for some acidity, it's pretty decent.  My bf's mole enchiladas were very delicious.  I usually find mole to be too sweet or too overpowering, but the mole at EP was just right.  I also like the beans and rice.  Absolutely nothing special but a good option.  I'm looking forward to coming in the summer for the patio and BYOB.  That might make things a lot more interesting. p.s. LOVE that they give you pico AND a red salsa for the chips, which I agree are WAY too oily.

This place is extremely convenient. Not only is it close to my house but it's open 24/7/365. The food is alright. I've had better Mexican food, and also worse. It was eerily quiet in there, which was kind of odd and no one else was in there except two police officers, so I wasn't really hopping out of my seat to run to the juke box.  The chips and pico de gallo/salsa are ok. However the chips are the greasiest. I had the chimi, which was actually extremely good. The service there is great, but they don't speak much English. They also have a 3.99 breakfast with free unlimited coffee, which I've heard is great, but I can't contest to that myself. But it sounds grand! All in all, if I'm ever rolling home in the middle of the night craving Mexican food, this is the perfect place.

The good - open 24/7/365 (unless the food inspector temporarily shuts them down) GREAT breakfast special - be sure to add chihuahua cheese to eggs nice staff - i would be ruder if I worked 24 hours a day! there is better mexican options for cheaper in Chicago, but this place serves a valuable function.  its also conveniently located a stones throw from my home.

I used to be a frequent patron of this fine establishment back in college. Since then, it is only on rare occasions that I am in the area and at a time when I crave decent mexican food.  I say decent because I now live near pilsen, a predominanty mexican neighborhood with exemplar food, and use that as the standard.   The staff is amazing, especially around the wee hours of the night, or morning.  They have a tremendous amount of tolerance and compassion for their inebriated patrons given their minimal command over the english language.  The food is very decent. I usually order an enchilada dish with mole sauce. Or the combination that has 1 taco, 1 tostada and 1 enchilada, accompanied with rice and beans.  Their homemade chips and pico-de gallo is my favorite, and the best I've ever had.  They are free and unlimited if you dine in.  However, sometimes I would make special trips to buy some and bring them home to graze on.  Last but not least, they are 24 hours 7 days a week 365 days a year open!

God, I love this place!!! I am a newly addicted yelper and for those who have read my reviews, I don't mean to sound like a lush. I'm sure I've entered quite a few reviews of me eating somewhere while intoxicated or hungover, but hey, I'm young and I like to go out and this place is my absolute fave after a night out. To be quite honest, i don't think I've ever eaten here without a few drinky drinks in me. It is so hard for me to NOT get the chilaquiles rojo. They are ABSOLUTE DELISH!!!  I sometimes say, "I'm gonna get a torta, or tacos, or pasole" as soon as that waitress comes, I end up ordering the chilaquiles. So I order the chilaquiles and I'll take a taste of whatever my friends ordered.  The pasole here is good as well and they serve it with freshly made tostadas. We have also ordered the nachos here with carne asada and those are pretty darn delish as well.  If this places ever closes I will cry like a colicky baby. I have yet to find another mexican place that serves chilaquiles as delish as they do.
ok food is okay, need more flavor ,the  decoracion to much  i dont think  i go back and the service sooooooo slow ...

The food was just okay, maybe i will return for more dishes since reviews varies. They are open for breakfast from 6 am to 11 am,  for only $3.99 2 eggs, 2 sausages/ham, 2 bacon and free coffee, ok i didn't have this order my  coworker did and she love the deal. 6am? breakfast? i do this for my hubby in pajamas (some days), i am glad this place was open so early. Service, at this hr i should say they were nice.

I wish I could say something nice here, but I'd really have to stretch.  The food is less than par & the salsa is comparable to runny tomato paste.  I had a friend once order a chicken burrito, out came a tortilla shell with shredded chicken and not a stitch of anything else on the plate. A true shame because I see potential here.  They have a patio (everyone in Chicago loves a good patio) and a decent location.  In a city full of traditional Mexican fare, El Presidente is less than authentic.

You know what... I usually reserve 5 stars for classier places. In my previous review I gave only 4 stars to El Presidente because even though it is my favorite Mexican place in Chicago, it is far from classy. Damn it though, I love this place. It may not be the best Mexican in the city, or have the best service, but for the price it is awesome. Everything here tastes like someones grandmother, who happened to be from Mexico, cooked it at home. It has so much more to offer than burritos and tacos, as well. The Pollo en Mole and the Carne de Puerco en Mole are fantastic, as are the Carnitas. In fact, the only place I have had better carnitas is in Pilsen. And I have tried mole at other Mexican places in Chicago and, unless they are known for it, it is usually horrible. Anyway, add that to being BYOB and this place is great. Just do me a favor and try something different. Save the burritos for Taco Bell.

It's cheap, BYO, and open late so there you go.  We went on a Sunday night and the place was actually packed (we got the last table).  It was full of Mexicans which is always a good sign...or so I thought.  The food was just okay, actually passable for Mexican.  My expectations were immediately dashed when I tasted the salsa.  The consistency was like tomato sauce and the spiciness seemed to come from a pepper I can't recall right now...oh yeah, that's right, the "tobasco" pepper!  Regardless, they do make their own chips, which is a plus in my book. I got the especial #8 (they do ask that you order the specials by number), so I obliged.  I must say that the flautas were pretty good.  The chilaquiles were over cooked and awful.  The enchilada was simply blah.  I did respect the guacamole which was fresh and tasty.  Not quite as good as Topolabampo, but decent. The service was pretty basic, and by basic I mean they bring you some drinks, then your food, and then your check.  Pretty standard really.  I never did get a refill of my water.  Then again, our server did notice we brought a bottle of fine $4.00 wine from Foremost Liquors in the strip mall across the street, so I gave her a decent tip. Bottom Line - listen to the other yelpers and only go to El Presidente when you're wasted at 4:00 am and the lovely DePaul ladies at John Barleycorn's have all gone home.

What happened? Really? I've been going to this place over, we'll let's just say perhaps longer than some Yelper's have been alive, 25+ years. The nachos and guac are still consistent, and will be my go to meal choices if I end up here in the middle of the night or if some of my friends insist on going. However, last few trips our order has been wrong, and the entree's seem to be, just not as good. More of an overall greasier taste. Or maybe it's just me, I'm older now and sober when I come in, perhaps I need to stop in after a Yelp event and things will seem as they were. *Scratching Head*

Open 24/7...which should be your first warning. The first time I ate here, it was after an afternoon of drinking. Everything tasted so great -- the salsa, pico de gallo, enchilladas, and fajitas.   Well...trying it sober is a completely different experience.  The food is barely tolerable.  So, if you're coming home late and get a craving for Mexican, definitely stop by.  But if you're sober and want to eat dinner here, don't even try...it ranks right up there with trying to eat a La Bamba's burritto in the middle of the day.

I had ONE terrible experience here, and that's worth the removal of one star. I ordered the Chile Rellenos, and I swear to GOD they were bathed in more oil than anything I have ever seen. I brought this to the waitress' attention, and she promptly took my plate back. When she came back with my food fifteen minutes later, it was the SAME fucking plate of chile rellenos bathing in canola oil. She didn't even bother to dab it with a napkin. I was pissed. Other than that, I love this place, especially because it is open 24/7.

There food is not the greatest but it's open 24 hours a day, all year long. The free basket of chips and salsa is basically the best part of the meal. I like the free chips better than most free chips mexican restaurants provide. If you can swing it, you would be better off going in for free chips, and leaving to get the main course at another mexican restaurant.  P.S. I gave it 3 stars mainly for the free chips.

I am totally suprised to see that people like the food here, we live right down the street and we will not go back. Our server forgot about us and the food was downright blech. In my stupidity I ordered the seafood enchilada which is filled with faux crab. And that's fine, but at least mention that on the menu so I'm not actually expecting it to have real seafood in it. Salsa was basically tomato sauce.

Don't come here for the standard late night burrito joint fare. Its open 24/7/365 and the entree's are great. The breakfast combos are awesome and I highly recommend the #10 if you are hungry.  Drove past many times and thought it was a run of the mill place, but you will actually crave it after you try it :) Semi decent patio in the back yard. Staff is nice. Prepare for a long wait on crazy holidays like black wednesday or new years etc.

i live right by this place and so i have drunkenly stumbled in from time to time.  this place serves its purpose.  how many 24 hour restaurants have stellar food? not many.  el pres is no different.  nothing from here really sticks out in my mind.  i vaguely remember the nachos and horchata.  both of which are hard to fck up. the awesome thing is the american breakfast in the morning until 11 with free coffee.  which have made hangovers less hellish on a few occasions.

I hadn't been to this place in probably 15 yrs and after eating dinner there tonight...we will never go back.  This place was dead there were only 2 other tables.  The waitress was horrible.  No personality, not nice at all. That should have been a sign the experience would suck.  When she brought our drinks we asked for more salsa. The lady went and wiped down 2 dirty tables, folded napkins & silverware.  A few minutes later she served our food and asked if we wanted more chips & salsa.  We said yes, she proceeded to go wipe down more tables & fold more napkins.   She finally came back with the salsa.  The food had no flavor, the salsa was horrible.  We quickly finished, wishing we had went to Dona Torta or El Tapitia instead of this place. It took forever to get our check.  What little service we received was not worth the tip to that woman.  Now we feel gross that we ate there!  ugh! yuck....      For the people that say it's good at 3am, when you're drunk anything tastes good!

This place is consistently great and has been since it was a tiny corner restaurant on Lincoln.  The only unfortunate thing is that the hot sauce isn't nearly as atomic as it was back in the day.  Still one of my favorites after all these years.  I've been there kind of regularly lately and the waitresses - who are all super - remember my order. Great guacamole, excellent mole sauce and I like the BYOB - you can get  Mexican beer at the liquor store at Ashland and Fullerton.  Plus, they have a huge bowl of really good chicken soup. And the complaints about food poisoning - I wouldn't be too quick to blame your Jagermeister and PBR excesses on El Pres...

Open 24hours and great location, too bad the food is flavorless.  I don't mean to nitpick, but the even the menu looks like a joke.  I've given this place many chances and the service is fine but the food is just terrible.
Great service and decent food, lots of choices to select from.  Try menudo or tacos al pastor.

After recently going here and hoping this may be a hidden gem, I'm thinking I probably won't stray away from Taco and Burrito House, or Taco Bell(know the latter sounds blasphemous, but I'll stand by saying that!) in the future. And it'd probably take a group of people coming here using the nice outdoor patio to make me come back. What can I say, this place perfectly falls right down the very middle of how mediocrity is defined. It's neither totally terrible, nor totally great. The chips I had were crunchy, but didn't have much flavor to them, and've had better salsa elsewhere. At least my horchata was decent, and the eggs w/chorizo wasn't bad. Still though, for the $6.50 price they were charging for it, Tony's Burrito Mex(seriously, bless that place!) probably would've had a better price for a similar item. I should've just stood outside, and asked one of the cops coming inside what they like about the food here, as I've always noticed passing by this place for years that it was popular w/them. But honestly, the only things I liked about this place was that the bathroom was pretty clean(unlike many other taquerias I've eaten at), the interior decor is nice, and the dessert display looked tempting(but successfully resisted those!). Wish I had just come with a group, to share food and figure out what food is actually decent here. Finally, I'll say this makes me appreciate the quality taquerias that exist in the city! (i.e. Tony's Burrito Mex, Taco and Burrito House, and El Norte to a lesser extent)

A bottle of Jim Beam, three grams of cocaine and after fifteen hours of sleep you wake up next to a girl from the burbs named Madison. Three days have gone by, you're desperately hungry, your serotonin and dopamine interferons have faded tremendously, and you just want to feel human again. It's time to drop by the El Presidente for chilaquiles. Chilaquiles  the best thing that ever happened to stale tortillas. Eggs, cheese, chorizo, chilies, salsa, usually with a side of rice and beans -- everything you'd ever want thrown together on a hot plate. And unlike some breakfast dishes, this one's available all day so it doesn't matter when you roll out of bed with your hangover.....or a girl from the burbs. For even Madison will exclaim, "çMuy sabroso!"

It's a pretty good place to grab a Burrito.  This eatery is one place where you really do get what you pay for.  The steak that they use in the Burritos is quite well done, so if that doesn't suit your taste, you might want to try something else.    This is a great place to people watch at 4 a.m.  Drunk hipsters, bikers and all forms of semi intelligent life are found here late at night.
Ummmmmmm Ok I gotta say it! This place sucks!!! By far one of the worst Mexican restaurants ever! Even drunk I wouldnt eat here!

I can't say El Presidente is authentic or particularly amazing, but their taco salads (chicken or carne asada) are both pretty stellar. You usually have to ask them to go easy on the sour cream and cheese or else they go kind of nuts, but it's seriously good stuff, sober or drunk. I've never eaten anything else besides the guacamole and the taco salads, so I can't comment on any of their other menu items. The fact that they deliver pretty late, and they're better than Taqueria el Ranchito is pretty much all you need to know.

El Presidente is my favorite late-night Mexican food option. In fact I love it so much that I've even had it sober.  ...and it was still good!  Their chicken tacos, sprinkled with strips of eggs, is delicious. Their service is alright I think. But what do you care, you're probably drunk!  A warning: the last time I was there was late night with some friends who then got up early the next day to tailgate before a game. Well apparently the food "didn't sit well" with them. And the fact that they were in a parking lot made them hate this place. A lot. I haven't been able to get them to go for the past five years.

Do you like guacamole?  I do.  Do you like horchata?  I sure as hell do.  This place has both and other stuff too.  Fantastic late night food and their service is very good for 3am.  Also, they will totally let you use their bathrooms when you're just driving to say Wrigley and really really have to go and you're not ordering food.

Lets face it... there are a lot of options for reasonably priced Mexican food.  And El Presidente, well, its not at the top of the mound.  The first thing that comes to mind is "Denny's of Mexican Food."  The food is alright, especially for what you're paying, but I can't say I'd go out of my way to get some.  That, and the service is down-right horrible.  The last time we went it was as if we didn't even exist to the waitress.  Maybe its gets better in the AM after a few beers... but for dinner, forget it. Edit:  Down from two stars to one... both my and my girlfriends stomachs have been a total mess since eating here last... we'll leave it at that.  Avoid.

I have to say I was disappointed by this restaurant.  My roommate and I decided to order some good, greasy mexican food to cure our hangovers on Sunday.  Our first disappointment with the place is they do not deliver.  Once we ordered, we went to pick up our food.  We got there and the entire place looked run down (old booths, tacky Easter decor) and probably not that clean.  The woman that got our to-go order ready acted put out by our request to change our Diet Coke to other types of pop.  Also, when my roommate called she specifically said the orders were separate.  However, when we went to pay they had it all on one bill.  They were able to split it up, but it still required additional time out of the day. When we got home we were excited to start eating our food.  We opened all the bags and realized they did not include my roommate's burrito order.  We called the restaurant immediately and he/she rudely replied she could pick up her burrito dinner in 10 minutes.  Once she got to the restaurant (within 10 minutes) she had to wait about 25 minutes for her burrito.  This means they had never even cooked the burrito in the first place probably!  Not to mention, the waitress was extremely mean to my roommate and acted upset by the whole situation when it was my roommate who should have been upset. The food was just so-so.  I am a vegetarian and decided to try the nachos.  The chips were so greasy and tasted of meat and/or seafood since they probably had been fried in the same dirty oil.  Neither of us got food poisoning or anything from the food, but neither of us was all that satisfied with the taste of the food overall.  I would stay away from this place unless it's 4am and the only place open!

If you are a drunk punk, you have eaten tacos here. You might not remember the name, or recognize the outside, but if you remember eating tacos whilst drunk, chances are the place that happened was El Presidente. I once found $240 in the gutter as I got out of a cab to eat tacos here with similarly drunk friends. I think it was my birthday. I don't remember how the food was, which means it was decent, as I vaguely remember eating here a million times, and have never cursed the name of El Presidente the next day, and am always happy to go back. The decor is festive with colorful paper chains, I think. The staff is friendly, the tables are clean, bathrooms are ample, the atmosphere inviting - when you are in the mood for cheap tacos and a non-judgmental atmosphere at a weird hour you can't go wrong with the President of Tacos.

I'm going to dissent from some of the low graders here, and be happy to report we have a tasty, cheap, 24 hour, nicely decorated, and generally all-around-pleasing experience here. One of the best Mexican spots for a good few blocks around it, a nice juke box, and for those who trust police (I don't on almost anything), they patronize the place all the time. Some of the prices and portions are far superior to some other Ashland spots, including the flan and other desserts.

Maybe I should have read reviews before I went to this place...although I didn't think it was that bad.  Someone mentioned they'd hit up Flash Taco before this place, and that says a LOT (I once didn't feel well after eating there).  I ate at El Presidente about 5 hours ago and have yet to feel any "aftershocks," so I am hoping I'm in the clear. I ate a steak burrito suizo - I usually don't do suizo but the waitress insisted on it, which I thought was strange, it didn't cost anything more so I said sure.  I thought it was good.  The rice wasn't that great. I did like that the burrito came with sour cream and guac.  The chips and salsa they give you were OK, the hot wasn't so much salsa, it looked like a bowl of Louisiana hot sauce or something (didn't taste as good as Louisiana). I might return if I'm in the area and there's no place closer, but it's not at the top of my list.

When my visiting friend saw the "open 24 hrs" sign  - we just had to go there for breakfast.  I must admit, I was excited about having refried beans with my eggs.  But I was disappointed.  There was nobody in there and service was terribly slow - the waitresses were mesmerized by the Spanish version of "Ricky Lake"  (As was I, I must admit, but I wasn't on the clock!)   Rarely do I have to put salt on Mexican food, but everything was so tasteless.

24 hour Mexican joint, with seating? Excellent.  Somtimes when it's 2am, and you need a burrito...you want to sit down and eat it. Not on a curb, or on the ground or sidewalk, in a booth. El Presidente welcomes drunkards and others with open, loving pastel booths, a tacky/funny/awesome decor, and decent Mexican food. Have a seat. Take your time. Eat. Be happy.

In your many choices for late nite Mexican food, please please don't choose this one!  There are sooo many better places!  Taco and Burrito House is right around the corner on Ashland and Fullerton, that place is decent and won't come back barking later in the night (or morning).  Although if you like completely flavorless and not fresh Mexican then try El Presidente.

I was tempted to give this place 4 stars because of their open late status , but I don't stay out late that much anymore so too bad for them. I haven't been here for a while , I kinda married someone that used to date one of the owners kids , tough breaks. Honestly I would not qualify this place as a destination place , more of a safe place that caters to circumstances. The decor is not anything that adds to it's appeal , unless you are a fan of Mexican kids on black velvet. The location is safe , even at 3am , but parking gets really tough after 8pm.  As for the food , it is authentic , if you are coming here expecting some sort of nuevo-Latin French-Mexican fusion , this ain't the place. If what you want is your standard fare , Tacos , Burritos  and the like , you should be ok. I'm not gonna be putting on any fireworks shows celebrating the food here , but I came here many a late night and ate well. I can vouch for the Steak tacos , steak burritos , the chicken flautas , and the chicken ranchero enchiladas. Go here with somebody that speaks Spanish if you can , I can't guarantee every server speaks enough English to fully understand a complex order.

If I could give this place ZERO STARS I would.  Do not eat here, even if it's 3am and you're drunk and need to put something in your tummy to absorb all that Jager.  The food is horrible.  Even sober, this place is just gross.
solid, late night food.  no beer is unfortunate, but still worth a trip.

With iving in the area and having odd sleeping and eating habits it was great to see a food joint that never closes, (though they did close last year to join in on the legalization of immigrant protest), but ALL Holidays and every other day, you can always find a warm spot here. Forget the Mexican food...for some reason it just doesn't do it for me...you can taste the good intentions and the service is appropriately friendly, but the flavor and overall wellness of eating their Mexican entrees just does not cut it for me. BYOB and no corkage fee is nice, as well as the cute little glass soda bottles of coke or pepsi, my roommate tells me their breakfast menu is killer and very cheap, though I have yet to go through this experience myself... But DO get the chicken soup. Homemade and made to order with a huge boiled quarter of chicken, corn on the cob, carrots, potatoes and cabbage...served with tortillas and rice on the side...this is comfort food when comfort is so needed. To go or dine in, its just what your hangover or flu so needed and ordered. Their chicken soup saved my sick days many a times and is one thing they got right.

Unless you're drunk as Mel Gibson, don't bother. Pretty mediocre. You're better off getting Allende or Taco & Burrito Palace or any of the other three hundred holes in the wall around the city, which are all less expensive and tastier.

Hungry at 3:00 a.m. for a burrito, chips, and refried beans? El Presidente is there for you.  Open 24/7, you can get good authentic mexican food at this family run restaurant.  There's usually a table available, the staff is friendly, and they serve you real and warm tortilla chips, home made by them.  You can't get any more authentic. Great for those late nights out, or even if you are late from the office. Also, the prices are great and the portions are big.

After seeing an 8 o'clock film at the Film Center I found myself hungry with no where to eat.  This tends to happen to me a lot.  There is simply nothing open at 10pm near Randolph and Washington and I end up taking the blue line home and driving somewhere open.   I almost opted for The Hollywood Grill, which is my usual 24/7 standby, when all of a sudden I remembered El Presidente. El Presidente isn't the best Mexican food I've ever had.  Not even close.  But its good and the waitresses let me practice my Spanish on them.  I had the Burrito Suizo which was $5.45.  It was one of the least expensive things on the menu which usually ranges from $7-$12.   It was pretty good and came with rice and beans.   The chips and salsa were decent and the waitress gave me extra limes to squeeze on top of the chips.  If this place served beer it would be an awesome place to come and chill for a few hours with friends.  Its BYOB though so if you were feeling up for it you could bring a 6 pack with you.  Its definitely a good late night option.  ** Nice plus - Instead of mints you get a handful of old school dum-dum lollipops with your bill!
Relatively inexpensive and not too bad for a 24/7 restaurant.  The burritos are a good option, but as usual, beware the refried beans if you don't eat meat... they taste of chorizo.
They have good shakes. The food is good but nothing spectacular. The benefit of this restaurant is that its open 24/7 days a week. For all those craving a burrito at 7 am will get one.

This is a great mexican restaurant and its open 24/7!  Perfect for the late night cravings, drunk or sober.. there's always people here, not the classiest crowd all the time but the food is worth it .. you can't expect much in the wee hours of the night!
